distribution: Amazonas (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Goiás (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America);Maranhão (Brazil Northeast, Brazil, Southern America);Mato Grosso (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America);Pará (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Roraima (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Tocantins (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Bolivia (Western South America, Southern America);Colombia (Western South America, Southern America);Guyana (Northern South America, Southern America);Venezuela (Northern South America, Southern America);
remarks: doi:10.3897/phytokeys.169.57996 The specific epithet means 'shy' and makes reference to the cleistogamous flowers, which open only a few millimetres.
